pr_title: Failed to update host password if username/password is not saved in db

timeline.message:
Failed to update host password if username/password is not saved in Cloudstack DB

If the entries for a host in host_details table are missing then we cant update the
password of the host using the cloudmonkey command
This can happen because host was removed earlier resulting in deletion
of entries in the database

This commit fixes the issue

(local) mgt01 > update hostpassword
hostid=50436ac8-b73a-4eaf-bbab-7adbd9a50870 username=root
password=cloudstack
{
  "success": true
}

Now the entries should be added in host_details table as well

timeline.bodyText: username from the command object can be null or empty ?
timeline.author: sureshanaparti

replies.author: ravening

replies.bodyText:
@ravening empty "" (or) "   " username string ?

@sureshanaparti those are non null values
replies.author: ravening
ravening

replies.bodyText: @ravening username is not null, but empty string, so can you add check for that ? Ex: "StringUtils.isBlank(command.getUsername())"
replies.author: sureshanaparti

replies.bodyText:
@ravening username is not null, but empty string, so can you add check for that ? Ex: "StringUtils.isBlank(command.getUsername())"

@sureshanaparti but why? For some hosts, username and password can be empty string
replies.author: ravening

replies.bodyText: @ravening if you pass username, then it shouldn't be empty, password can be empty. can you confirm if username  is persisted with empty value in the host_details table?
replies.author: sureshanaparti

replies.bodyText:
@sureshanaparti
(local) 🐱 > update hostpassword hostid=50436ac8-b73a-4eaf-bbab-7adbd9a50870 password=cloudstack username="  "
🙈 Error: (HTTP 431, error code 4350) The username is not same for the hosts..
(local) 🐱 >
(local) 🐱 > update hostpassword hostid=50436ac8-b73a-4eaf-bbab-7adbd9a50870 password=cloudstack username=""
🙈 Error: (HTTP 431, error code 4350) The username is not same for the hosts..
(local) 🐱 >
replies.author: ravening

replies.bodyText: @ravening can you test your changes when "nv == null" with above username and share the persisted records in the host_details table?
replies.author: sureshanaparti
ravening

replies.bodyText: can you share the entries in host_details table of that test?
replies.author: sureshanaparti

replies.bodyText:
can you share the entries in host_details table of that test?

I think it's not going anywhere further. Can you let me know what exactly you are looking for?
replies.author: ravening

replies.bodyText:
can you share the entries in host_details table of that test?

@sureshanaparti  the last result I pasted was tested when host_details entry were removed for that host
replies.author: ravening

replies.bodyText: @ravening No point in saving password with username empty. Hope you got it. Wanted to confirm the same based on the entries persisted in host_details table for your test. Can you share these? Thanks.
replies.author: sureshanaparti

replies.bodyText: @sureshanaparti @ravening we had the issue in the past that Removed kvm host is added back to cloudstack when cloudstack-agent is started. in that case, there is no username/password saved in host_details for the host (because the entries are removed from db when host is removed, but not added back).
replies.author: weizhouapache

timeline.bodyText: cmd.getUsername() can be null or empty here, please check.
timeline.author: sureshanaparti

replies.bodyText: @ravening Username null or empty fix is not addressed here. Please check.
replies.author: sureshanaparti

timeline.bodyText: @ravening should we use 'userNameWithoutSpaces' instead of cmd.getUserName() ?
timeline.author: weizhouapache

replies.bodyText: yes correct. probably i missed it. will change that
replies.author: ravening

timeline.bodyText: @ravening  Username null or empty fix is missing here.
timeline.author: sureshanaparti
